alert.note: Alert for Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 11:19AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Bradford, Baker, northeastern Union, east central Columbia and south central Charlton Counties through NOON EDT... At 1118 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Fargo to Sanderson to New River. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Butler, Raiford, Taylor, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Sanderson, Beasley, Ellerbee and Johnstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
